page.title: 02ST. Margarets Church Spaxton
page.content: The church stands in the old churchyard surrounded by ancient yew trees. Nothing is known of the founding of the church,but there is S axon or Early Norman herringbone stonework in the north wall denoting a church built in the 10th century. Up to the 13th century the church would have been as big as the present Nave,with a much smaller Chancel. The {Church}was rebuilt in the 15th century,the south aisle and chapel were added a hundred years later. The{ {tower}was built in 1434 The first pews added about 1536.During the 18th century the wagon roof was plastered in and the chancel remodelled. T HE church is famous for its Fullers bench ends. The tools of the trade for beating the freshly woven cloth are shown.R egular sunday sThe Churchl
